{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-233-06-A |Item_parent=Valvulopathies |Item_parent_short=Valvulopathies |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the Primary Value of Echocardiography in MI, IA, AR and MR |Description=Positive diagnosis, diagnosis of mechanism and aetiology, diagnosis of severity |Section=Additional tests |Contributors=Myriam Akodad,Florence Leclercq |Order=6}} *Transthoracic cardiac echocardiography (TTE) is the key test for assessing valvular heart disease. Trans-oesophageal echocardiography (TEE) is mainly used to assess mitral valve disease and in cases of suspected endocarditis. *The purpose of echocardiography is to "confirm the diagnosis", assess the "severity" of the valve disease, determine its "aetiology", assess its "impact" and look for "other valve diseases". *The main abnormalities are summarised in the table below:
[[File:Ultrasound valvulopathy.png|centred|vignette|alt=|900x900px|Characteristics of valvulopathy on ultrasound]]
[[File:Mitral insufficiency.png|centre|vignette|900x900px|ETO with posterior mitral valve prolapse (arrow) and eccentric regurgitant flow (Carpentier type II organic MI)]] [[File:Figure 3.png|alt=ETT with MI by ring dilatation + leaflet tenting and central regurgitant flow (type I+III MI) |centre|vignette|900x900px|ETT with MI by ring dilatation + leaflet tenting and central regurgitant flow (type I+III MI)]] [[File:Aortic insufficiency.png|alt=ETT with massive IA (regurgitant flow in the LV) in colour and continuous doppler|centre|vignette|900x900px|ETT with tight RA: calcified aortic valve with limited opening (A) and high gradient in continuous doppler (B)]] [[File:Figure IA.png|centred|thumb|900x900px|ETT with massive IA (regurgitant flow in the LV) in colour and continuous Doppler]] [[File:Figure 5.png|centred|vignette|900x900px|ET0 with tight MR: calcified remodeled mitral and high gradient in continuous Doppler (A) with limited aperture and area <1.5cm2 in 2D (B) and 3D (C)]]]

question.question: What is the primary purpose of echocardiography in the assessment of valvular heart disease?
question.option_a: To assess the severity of the valve disease only
question.option_b: To confirm the diagnosis, assess the severity, determine the aetiology, assess the impact, and look for other valve diseases
question.option_c: To determine the aetiology of the valve disease only
question.option_d: To assess the impact of the valve disease on other organs only
